review: I should have returned it at once to start with it was freezing up constantly.  I had to take the batteries out and put them back in and then it start working again.  Besides this annoying feature, I am liked it pretty well.  Don't know if I have a defective Roku or what.  It has totally stopped working.  when it did work, I liked it pretty good.  NOW that it won't work, AND I have had trouble with it from the start, AND I can't return it due to the non-existent warranty, I HATE IT,  WATCH OUT, IF YOU GET ONE AND IT GIVES EVEN A TINY BIT OF TROUBLE, RETURN IT

review: Many online posts concerning this issue. I have a soundbar with a wireless subwoofer, and another pair of wireless speakers in my living room. Not sure if this is part of the problem with roku stick wireless remote. Anyhow, several times a day, I have to remove the roku remote's batteries, press the remote's pairing button, then reset the roku stick. I recommend not getting the roku stick, and instead getting another product. Or, maybe the Roku 2, or Roku 3 stand alone models, since they use infrared instead of wireless.
